Hello and welcome to the <#1128037342284877914> channel <:nfteth:822186186016948314>

Feel free to reach out to the Mask Network Team at any point with your questions!

üëÄ **ABOUT**
**Mask Network** brings privacy and benefits from Web3 to social media like Facebook & Twitter - with an open-sourced browser extension.
Next.ID was initiated by the core team responsible for the development of Mask Network last year.

Next ID is an open-source protocol designed for developers to create and manage identities. The Next ID protocol acts as a secure conduit connecting various web2 and web3 identifiers, such as wallets, Twitter profiles, ENS names, Lens profiles, and more.

When a person's different identifiers are linked together, they form an identity graph, creating powerful, portable, and self-sovereign digital identities. We refer to these identities, digital representations of self, as avatars at Next ID.

Hi! This is Afra from Mask Network!
Hi Everyone! Wei from Mask Network & Next.ID, feel free to ask question you may have
hello team, I am facing an issue with twitter verfication from docs
sorry i was using eth public instead of next avatar private key my bad
public key*

hello  guys,I'm still unable to understand what exactly to pass in the public_key, whether the only way is by generating a new key pair as specified in docs or is possible to import  exisiting address from ethereum chain

Hi, technically NextID Avatar is exactly the same as Ethereum wallet (secp256k1 public/private keypair). What NextID want is `0xHEXSTRING` representation of your avatar's public key. 
Both Compressed `0x33BYTES` and Uncompressed `0x65BYTES` are supported.
Hello <@346635066912407553>  when I tried to pass the public as mentioned above it is giving me ‚Äúpublic key not recognised ‚Äú error‚Äù. How to proceed from here
for debugging i have attached screenshots and video of it
I want to see what request body you used in this req
Here is a request sample in the doc: https://docs.next.id/rest-api/proofservice-api#proof-payload
‚¨ÜÔ∏è `Body` part
Doc here shows which format of public key NextID accepts: https://docs.next.id/proof-service/ps-faq#how-do-i-generate-a-avatar
compressed example, in the docs  it is mentioned that public key should start from an certain value like 0x02 but that doesn't work for me as well
Your `"public_key"` looks more like a wallet address, instead of a public key. Notice that wallet address is not equivalent to public key.
Hello everyone, our Chief Technology Officer is here. We invite you to visit our booth to share your ideas and seek assistance.<:nfthearteyes:822186185727148053>

Hey guys, trying to use the `profile` route that's used by web3.bio but struggling to get a request to respond, I was told your Tiger network is down, and to try using: https://relation-service.next.id/ but still getting Internal Server Errors
i.e. https://relation-service.next.id/profile/ENS/jordydutch.eth

hey guys this is the post content which i'm getting back from the proof/payload post method  "üé≠ Verify <@767041451271913482> with @NextDotID.\nSig: %SIG_BASE64%\nMisc: ca4c2efc-012f-4809-a520-b4c986597e9a|1690055368|" and after replacing the sig it looks like this  "üé≠ Verify <@767041451271913482> with @NextDotID.
Sig: 0x95b47e8d596934f178a511cd73cd219953046e210ced39e99b992ed764e521432d45a469c5067ee94b2b10a7bbedfb22e9fb1b8c88386de076e19058ebb6a0b91b
Misc: ca4c2efc-012f-4809-a520-b4c986597e9a|1690055368| " but the example given in docs is this https://twitter.com/BinaryHB/status/1543541274254639104.
this is the method i'm using for recovering public key and it is quite large, I have solved other issues this is the last one remainig
Hi I had created a tg group for you üëç
we have team there helping you üëÄ

üëÄ **ABOUT**
Dear Builders,

Mask Network brings privacy and benefits from Web3 to social media like Facebook & Twitter - with an open-sourced browser extension. Next.ID was initiated by the core team responsible for the development of Mask Network last year.

Next.ID is an open-source protocol designed for developers to create and manage identities. The Next.ID protocol acts as a secure conduit connecting various web2 and web3 identifiers, such as wallets, Twitter profiles, ENS names, Lens profiles, and more.

When a person's different identifiers are linked together, they form an identity graph, creating powerful, portable, and self-sovereign digital identities. We refer to these identities, digital representations of self, as **Avatars** at Next ID.
